block.p: Sara Corinne Jorgensen, the daughter of Mary and Earl Jorgensen of Shorewood, Wis., was married yesterday to Michael Arthur Klotz, a son of Irene and John Klotz of Riverdale, the Bronx. The Rev. Dr. Paul S. Johnson performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Princeton, N.J.
The couple graduated from Beloit College, the bride magna cum laude.

Sara Corinne Jorgensen, the daughter of Mary and Earl Jorgensen of Shorewood, Wis., was married yesterday to Michael Arthur Klotz, a son of Irene and John Klotz of Riverdale, the Bronx. The Rev. Dr. Paul S. Johnson performed the ceremony at the Unitarian Universalist Congregation of Princeton, N.J.
The couple graduated from Beloit College, the bride magna cum laude.

Ms. Jorgensen, 25, is keeping her name. She is a candidate for a doctorate in history at Princeton, from which she received a master's degree in history. Her father is a music teacher in the St. Francis, Wis., public schools. Her mother is a choral soloist.

Mr. Klotz, 27, is an assistant vice president and investment analyst in the Plainsboro, N.J., office of Merrill Lynch & Company. His father is a lawyer in Manhattan and the Sierra Club's liaison to the United Nations. The bridegroom's mother is the clinical outreach director for the Research Consortium of Family Studies in Genetics of Epilepsy at the Mount Sinai Medical Center in Manhattan.
